rdf:Description.rdfs:label: dcterms:conformsTo (SKG-IF labels: persistent_identity_systems)
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The persistent identifier systems that are used by a Data source to identify the `ProductType` it supports.
rdf:Description.dc:description:
In SKG-IF, it is used in the following classes (domain): * dcat:DataService
In SKG-IF, it is used to link to entities belonging to the following classes (range): * dcterms:Standard

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: fabio:Repository (SKG-IF labels: repository)
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: services for the deposition, preservation, discovery, and access of research products metadata and files, e.g. PANGAEA, Zenodo, B2SHARE, EGI AppDB, BioTools

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: datacite:Identifier
rdf:Description.dc:description:
The properties that can be used with this class are:
* datacite:usesIdentifierScheme -[1]-> datacite:IdentifierScheme * literal:hasLiteralValue -[1]-> rdfs:Literal

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: dcterms:requires (SKG-IF labels: pid_schemes)
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Persistent identifier schemes used to refer to ProductTypes.
rdf:Description.dc:description:
In SKG-IF, it is used in the following classes (domain): * dcterms:Standard
In SKG-IF, it is used to link to entities belonging to the following classes (range): * datacite:IdentifierScheme

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: literal:hasLiteralValue (SKG-IF labels: value)
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The external identifier.
rdf:Description.dc:description:
In SKG-IF, it is used in the following classes (domain): * datacite:Identifier
In SKG-IF, it is used to link to entities belonging to the following data types (range): * rdfs:Literal

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: frapo:ResearchInformationSystem (SKG-IF labels: cris system)
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A current research information system (CRIS) is an information system to store, manage and exchange contextual metadata for the research products funded by a research funder or conducted at a research-performing organisation

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: fabio:Journal (SKG-IF labels: journal archive)
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Data sources for the deposition (submission), preservation, discovery, and access of scientific journal articles (metadata and files), e.g. publishers sites, journal sites, etc.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: odrl:target (SKG-IF labels: target)
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: the types of resources to which the policy applies to. Each item in the list should be compliant with the following terms:
rdf:Description.dc:description:
In SKG-IF, it is used in the following classes (domain): * odrl:Policy
In SKG-IF, it is used to link to entities belonging to the following classes (range): * owl:Thing

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: datacite:hasIdentifier (SKG-IF labels: identifiers)
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Objects representing external identifiers for the entity.
rdf:Description.dc:description:
In SKG-IF, it is used in the following classes (domain): * dcat:DataService
In SKG-IF, it is used to link to entities belonging to the following classes (range): * datacite:Identifier

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: dcterms:subject (SKG-IF labels: disciplines)
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The disciplines for which a Data source is dedicated. The disciplines must be specified using the Library of Congress Classification codes, available at https://id.loc.gov/authorities/classification (e.g. `PA3000-PA3049` for classical literature). In case a Data source is discipline agnostic, the string `all` should be specified.
rdf:Description.dc:description:
In SKG-IF, it is used in the following classes (domain): * dcat:DataService
In SKG-IF, it is used to link to entities belonging to the following classes (range): * owl:Thing

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: coar:c_16ec (SKG-IF labels: restricted access)
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: This policy provides the possibility of having / handling restricted access to the resources in the Data source (from COAR Access Rights 1.0).

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: schema:audience (SKG-IF labels: audience)
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The property defines the target audiences of the users of a Data source.
rdf:Description.dc:description:
In SKG-IF, it is used in the following classes (domain): * dcat:DataService
In SKG-IF, it is used to link to entities belonging to the following classes (range): * schema:Audience

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: dcterms:coverage (SKG-IF labels: research_product_type, for)
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The types of OpenAIRE entities managed by a Data source, based on the EOSC vocabulary Research Product Type.
rdf:Description.dc:description:
In SKG-IF, it is used in the following classes (domain): * dcat:DataService * dcterms:Standard
In SKG-IF, it is used to link to entities belonging to the following classes (range): * owl:Thing

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: SKG-O: data-source
rdf:Description.dc:title: The SKG-IF Ontology: data-source
rdf:Description.dc:creator: Scientific Knowledge Graphs â€“ Interoperability Framework (SKG-IF) WG
rdf:Description.dc:rights: This work is distributed under a Creative Commons Attribution License (https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/4.0/legalcode)
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: SKG-O, the SKG-IF Ontology, is not yet another bibliographic ontology. Rather it is just a place where existing and complementary ontological entities from several other ontologies, all employed in the Scientific Knowledge Graph Interoperability Framework (SKG-IF), are grouped together for the purpose of providing descriptive metadata compliant with the SKG-IF Data Model.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: foaf:page (SKG-IF labels: documented_at)
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: the URL of the document that describes the policy.
rdf:Description.dc:description:
In SKG-IF, it is used in the following classes (domain): * odrl:Policy
In SKG-IF, it is used to link to entities belonging to the following classes (range): * foaf:Document

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: fabio:Catalog (SKG-IF labels: aggregator)
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: services for the aggregation of metadata about research products (and other entities) that are mainly collected (aka harvested) from data sources via APIs and then possibly curated/enriched by end-users, e.g. BASE, NARCIS, GESIS, B2FIND, OpenAIRE Research Graph

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: schema:Audience
rdf:Description.dc:description:
The properties that can be used with this class are:
* schema:audienceType -[1]-> xsd:string

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: odrl:archive (SKG-IF labels: preservation)
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: This policy provides a comprehensive framework for the long-term preservation of the research products. Principles aims and responsibilities must be clarified. An important aspect is the description of preservation concepts to ensure the technical and conceptual utility of the content.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: dcterms:description (SKG-IF labels: description)
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: describe the type of policy, if necessary.
rdf:Description.dc:description:
In SKG-IF, it is used in the following classes (domain): * odrl:Policy
In SKG-IF, it is used to link to entities belonging to the following data types (range): * xsd:string

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: coar:c_14cb (SKG-IF labels: metadata only access)
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: This policy provides the possibility of having / handling metadata only access refers to the resources in the Data source (from COAR Access Rights 1.0).

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: dcat:theme (SKG-IF labels: data_source_classification)
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The specific type of a Data source, based on the vocabulary Data source Classification.
rdf:Description.dc:description:
In SKG-IF, it is used in the following classes (domain): * dcat:DataService
In SKG-IF, it is used to link to entities belonging to the following classes (range): * owl:Thing

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: vivo:Publisher (SKG-IF labels: publisher archive)
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Scientific literature publisher, e.g. Elsevier, Copernicus, Frontiers, Springer, providing metadata and files of scientific publications relative to journals and conferences

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: datacite:usesIdentifierScheme (SKG-IF labels: scheme)
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The scheme for the external identifier (e.g., a DOI).
rdf:Description.dc:description:
In SKG-IF, it is used in the following classes (domain): * datacite:Identifier
In SKG-IF, it is used to link to entities belonging to the following classes (range): * datacite:IdentifierScheme

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: odrl:action (SKG-IF labels: about)
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: the type of policy to consider.
rdf:Description.dc:description:
In SKG-IF, it is used in the following classes (domain): * odrl:Policy
In SKG-IF, it is used to link to entities belonging to the following classes (range): * odrl:Action

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: dcterms:Standard
rdf:Description.dc:description:
The properties that can be used with this class are:
* dcterms:coverage -[1]-> owl:Thing * dcterms:requires -[1..N]-> datacite:IdentifierScheme

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: odrl:Policy
rdf:Description.dc:description:
The properties that can be used with this class are:
* dcterms:description -[0..1]-> xsd:string * foaf:page -[0..1]-> foaf:Document * odrl:action -[1]-> odrl:Action * odrl:target -[0..N]-> owl:Thing

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: schema:audienceType (SKG-IF labels: audience_type)
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: the type of the audience based on the vocabulary Jurisdiction.
rdf:Description.dc:description:
In SKG-IF, it is used in the following classes (domain): * schema:Audience
In SKG-IF, it is used to link to entities belonging to the following data types (range): * xsd:string

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: odrl:hasPolicy (SKG-IF labels: policy)
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The policies followed by a Data source.
rdf:Description.dc:description:
In SKG-IF, it is used in the following classes (domain): * dcat:DataService
In SKG-IF, it is used to link to entities belonging to the following classes (range): * odrl:Policy

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: coar:c_abf2 (SKG-IF labels: open access)
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: This policy provides the possibility of having / handling Data source resources that are immediately and permanently online (from COAR Access Rights 1.0).

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: dcat:DataService (SKG-IF labels: Data source)
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A Data source is a service or platform where a Research product (its metadata and files) is stored, preserved, and made discoverable and accessible. A data source is described by the EOSC Profile for data sources (https://wiki.eoscfuture.eu/display/PUBLIC/D.+v4.00+EOSC+Data+Source+Profile).
rdf:Description.dc:description:
The properties that can be used with this class are:
* datacite:hasIdentifier -[0..N]-> datacite:Identifier * dcat:theme -[0..1]-> owl:Thing * dcterms:conformsTo -[0..N]-> dcterms:Standard * dcterms:coverage -[0..N]-> owl:Thing * dcterms:subject -[0..N]-> owl:Thing * foaf:name -[0..1]-> rdfs:Literal * odrl:hasPolicy -[0..N]-> odrl:Policy * schema:audience -[0..N]-> schema:Audience

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: odrl:aggregate (SKG-IF labels: submission)
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: This policy provides a comprehensive framework for the contribution of research products. Criteria for submitting content to the repository as well as product preparation guidelines can be stated. Concepts for quality assurance may be provided.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: foaf:name (SKG-IF labels: name)
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Name of the Data source.
rdf:Description.dc:description:
In SKG-IF, it is used in the following classes (domain): * dcat:DataService
In SKG-IF, it is used to link to entities belonging to the following data types (range): * rdfs:Literal

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: coar:c_f1cf (SKG-IF labels: embargoed access)
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: This policy provides the possibility of having / handling embargoed access refers to the resources in the Data source (from COAR Access Rights 1.0).

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: fabio:Database (SKG-IF labels: scientific database)
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Scientific Databases intended to store structured information about scientific entities, e.g. PROTDB, ENA, ECRIN Studies Database
